incidents.name: Cloudflare Pages, Workers, API and Dashboard issues

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.
Cloudflare Dashboard is also affected: users might observe delays and/or errors. The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Cloudflare is investigating issues with Cloudflare Pages and Cloudflare Workers: Customers may encounter errors when attempting to create new Cloudflare Pages based sites, as well as new Cloudflare Workers.  This issue does not affect any other Cloudflare services.

We are working to mitigate this problem.  More updates to follow shortly.

incidents.name: Increased HTTP 522 Errors in Chennai, India

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Cloudflare is investigating an increased level of HTTP 522 errors in Chennai, India region.

We are working to analyze and mitigate this problem.  More updates to follow shortly.

incidents.name: Cloudflare Dashboard service issues: Password reset failures

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
Impact is limited and only affecting a small amount of users. We are continuing to investigate the root cause of the issue.

Cloudflare is investigating issues with Cloudflare Dashboard: Some customers attempting to perform password resets will observe error responses, and emails are not being sent.
These issues do not affect the serving of cached files via the Cloudflare CDN or other security features at the Cloudflare Edge.
We are currently working on a resolution. More updates to follow shortly.

incidents.name: Duplicate email notices sent regarding upgrades from Automatic SSL/TLS service

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
Users may receive multiple email notifications on Automatic SSL/TLS service.

incidents.name: Advanced security events and security events showing 0 events.

incident_updates.body:
Some customers may have received notifications for advanced security events and security events showing 0 events beginning Friday the 22nd. 

This number is an error, but the alert is correct. Please refer to the dashboard to check for the correct value.

This is now resolved.

incidents.name: Issues with Workers Smart Placement

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Since 2024-11-21 13:00, Workers Smart Placement is not analyzing Workers and potentially running them in non-optimal locations. This mainly affects Workers that just turned Smart Placement on. If a Worker already has Smart Placement on, it will continue with the last analyzed placement.

Workers traffic is not affected.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
Cloudflare is investigating an issue where customers may have received a false positive "521: Web Server Is Down" email alert. The issue has been identified, and a fix is being implemented.

incidents.name: CDN mTLS certificate issue

incident_updates.body: This incident is now resolved.
A fix for this issue has been applied and we are currently monitoring the results.

Custom certificates used for mTLS with customer origins fails to load. This issue will cause customer's origin servers to reject these connections due to lack of certificates. We are currently working on a fix for this issue.

incidents.name: Connectivity issue with WARP clients released 2024-11-11

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

Cloudflare released a WARP Client update on 2024-11-11 for Linux, macOS, and Windows. Due to reports from several customers that a portion of their fleets could not connect to WARP after upgrading to this new version, a decision was made on 2024-11-12 at 15:39 to pull the problematic macOS GA build (2024.11.143.0). Windows has now also been pulled.

Customers are advised to revert to the previous stable releases. A fix is underway.

This incident is continuing https://www.cloudflarestatus.com/incidents/tlw2jm9b4l42

incidents.name: Cloudflare Dashboard and Cloudflare API service issues

incident_updates.body: This incident is now resolved.
The cause of this issue was identified and a fix was implemented. We are currently monitoring the results.

Cloudflare is investigating issues with Cloudflare Dashboard and related APIs.

These issues do not affect the serving of cached files via the Cloudflare CDN or other security features at the Cloudflare Edge.

Customers using the Dashboard / Cloudflare APIs are impacted as requests might fail and/or errors may be displayed.

incidents.name: Connectivity issue with WARP client 2024.11.143.0 on macOS

incident_updates.body:
Cloudflare released a WARP Client update on 2024-11-11 for Linux, macOS, and Windows. Due to reports from several customers that a portion of their fleets could not connect to WARP after upgrading to this new version, a decision was made on 2024-11-12 at 15:39 to pull the problematic macOS GA build (2024.11.143.0). Windows and Linux releases are not affected by this.

Customers are advised to revert to the previous stable release (2024.9.346.0) if they experience issues with macOS devices unable to connect.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

We are working to mitigate this problem.  More updates to follow shortly.

incidents.name: HTTP Analytics Delays

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Cloudflare HTTP Analytics processing is running behind for US-only customers since 15:00 UTC. This affects timely delivery of customer data. These delays do not impact analytics for DNS and Rate Limiting.
